channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: ‘Chops’ tag all along road, 28th October
item.description:
Needs removing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 121 Saint Paul's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass in lane between Cobham Road and Swindon Road, 28th October
item.description:
Over the course of the summer, people have broken glass alcohol bottles in the lane and even though it has been pushed to the sides there is a large build-up of glass in amongst the weeds. THere is also glass all over the pavement near the Swindon Road entrance to the lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Cobham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety rail missing from footbridge, 28th October
item.description:
The safety rail has fallen off or been removed from the footbridge over the river Chelt at St. Judes Walk/Charlton Park. It was lying at the side of the footpath so I have placed it out of sight underneath the bridge to hopefully stop it being used as a weapon, pole vault, kaber, etc. Without the rail being there the bridge is a danger to small children, dogs and drunks crawling home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 12 Saint Judes Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obscured speed limit signs, 27th October
item.description:
Hedge rows and trees are blocking visibility of the speed limit signs along the Winchcombe Road, Brockhampton around Cotehay farmhouse. An increasing number of drivers are ignoring the limit
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping: fridges and furniture Lansdown Crescent, 26th October
item.description:
Lots of bulky flytipped items including fridges and furniture on pavement outside 24 Lansdown Crescent. (I notice that this has been previously reported over a week ago)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 22 Lansdown Crescent, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing cover from inspection chamber., 26th October
item.description:
DOG BARK LANE, DRAINAGE DITCH EAST SIDE. Manhole cover missing from brick inspection chamber. Danger to walkers, animals etc.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on verge and in bushes, 25th October
item.description:
An amount of flytipping (pillows and plastic tubs) plus more general litter in bushes on junction of Hesters Way Rd and Oldbury and up alleyway to side of 40-50 Oldbury.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 50 Oldbury Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Open Reach Cabinets, 25th October
item.description:
All of the Open Teach ( BY) cabinets at the junction of Montpellier Spa Road with Montpellier Parade have been covered in graffiti

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Montpellier Parade, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More potholes!, 25th October
item.description:
The location is the Cleeve Common Road just past Upper Hill Farm and into the trees. Potholes have opened up on the road effectively on the track a car has to take and little option in avoiding hitting the potholes. Please cam thes be repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Edge of road at a passing place badly eroded, 25th October
item.description:
The location is on the Cleeve Common Road just up from a the burnt oak where there is a passing place. On the right hand side going towards the common the road has badly and deeply eroded. Having been caught twice at this point - my vehicle actually grounded on the first occasion and luckily no damage. Please can this be repaired and other edges of this road filled in where vehicles have no option but to run onto the side of the road to pass.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Sevenhampton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deepening Potholes and more of them, 25th October
item.description:
This area is effectively one big pothole! About 20 yards of road are just one pothole after the other. Quite a lot of traffic use this road and damage to tyres are a distinct possibility. Please can the area be repaired!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
